label: thm-perturbation-operator-continuity
name: Probabilistic Continuity of the Perturbation Operator

relations_established.label: rel-perturbation-operator-probabilistic-continuity-other
relations_established.expression: Perturbation operator is probabilistically continuous in N-particle displacement metric

natural_language_statement:
Let $\mathcal{S}_1$ and $\mathcal{S}_2$ be two input swarms. Let the output swarms be generated by independent applications of the Perturbation Operator: $\mathcal{S}'_1 \sim \Psi_{\text{pert}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \cdot)$ and $\mathcal{S}'_2 \sim \Psi_{\text{pert}}(\mathcal{S}_2, \cdot)$. Assume the chosen **Perturbation Measure** satisfies the **Axiom of Bounded Second Moment of Perturbation**. Then for any probability of failure $\delta \in (0, 1)$, the squared **N-Particle Displacement Metric** between the two output swarms is bounded with probability at least $1-\delta$ by:
$$d_{\text{Disp},\mathcal{Y}}(\mathcal{S}'_1, \mathcal{S}'_2)^2 \le 3 \frac{\Delta_{\text{pos}}^2(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2)}{N} + \lambda_{\mathrm{status}} \frac{n_c(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2)}{N} + \frac{6}{N} \left( B_M(N) + B_S(N, \delta/2) \right)$$
